alert.note: Alert for Lake County Portion of Lake-Napa-Sonoma Unit (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued August 28 at 11:01PM PDT until August 30 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...Gusty north to northeasterly winds and low relative humidity values developing overnight Tuesday through overnight Wednesday... .North to Northeasterly winds will increase across far eastern portions of fire weather zone 264 overnight Tuesday through Wednesday night, with gusts in excess of 30 mph. These winds, along with fair relative humidity recovery, will create locally critical fire weather conditions. Gusty conditions will diminish by late Wednesday. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 264. * WIND...Northeast increasing to 20 mph with gusts to 30 mph across exposed upper slopes, ridgetops, and some wind-oriented gaps and valleys. * HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Lake County Portion of Lake-Napa-Sonoma Unit
